title: Authors and Citation
text: Punnett (2021). probabilityDistributions: Useful probability distributions. https://primer-e.github.io/probabilityDistributions, https://github.com/PRIMER-e/probabilityDistributions.
code: @Manual{,   title = {probabilityDistributions: Useful probability distributions},   author = {Andrew Punnett},   year = {2021},   note = {https://primer-e.github.io/probabilityDistributions, https://github.com/PRIMER-e/probabilityDistributions}, }

title: Useful probability distributions
text: goal probabilityDistributions provide library useful probability distributions R Stan.

title: Useful probability distributions
text: can install development version probabilityDistributions GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("PRIMER-e/probabilityDistributions")

title: Useful probability distributions
text: basic example shows calculate Zero-Inflated Poisson (ZIP) probability mass using R Stan:
code: library(probabilityDistributions) library(rstan) #> Loading required package: StanHeaders #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> rstan (Version 2.21.2, GitRev: 2e1f913d3ca3) #> For execution on a local, multicore CPU with excess RAM we recommend calling #> options(mc.cores = parallel::detectCores()). #> To avoid recompilation of unchanged Stan programs, we recommend calling #> rstan_options(auto_write = TRUE) #> Do not specify '-march=native' in 'LOCAL_CPPFLAGS' or a Makevars file  stan_model_code <- paste0("functions { ",                            zi_poisson_lpmf_stan[["source_code"]],                            " }",                           sep = "\n")  model_listing <- stanc(model_code = stan_model_code)  stan_function_names <- expose_stan_functions(model_listing)  print(stan_function_names) #> [1] "zi_poisson_lpmf"  zi_poisson_lpmf(5, 7.5, 0.2) #> [1] -2.43612  dzip(5, 7.5, 0.2, log = TRUE) #> [1] -2.43612

title: Useful probability distributions
text: making changes run following command committing rebuild package readme, also home page.
code: devtools::build_readme()

what: Negative Binomial Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — neg_binomial_2_lpmf_stan
title: Negative Binomial Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — neg_binomial_2_lpmf_stan
text: two negative binomial density functions built Stan: second one uses mean -dispersion parameterisation familiar ecologists. See https://mc-stan.org/docs/2_19/functions-reference/negative-binomial-distribution.html https://mc-stan.org/docs/2_19/functions-reference/nbalt.html details.
code: real neg_binomial_lpmf(ints n | reals alpha, reals beta) real neg_binomial_2_lpmf(ints y | reals mu, reals phi)

title: Negative Binomial Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — neg_binomial_2_lpmf_stan
code: cat(neg_binomial_2_lpmf_stan[["source_code"]]) #> // There are two negative binomial density functions built into Stan: #> // #> // real neg_binomial_lpmf(ints n | reals alpha, reals beta) #> // real neg_binomial_2_lpmf(ints y | reals mu, reals phi) #> // #> // The second one uses the mean and over-dispersion parameterisation familiar #> // to ecologists. #> // #> // See <https://mc-stan.org/docs/2_19/functions-reference/negative-binomial-distribution.html> #> // and <https://mc-stan.org/docs/2_19/functions-reference/nbalt.html> for #> // more details.

title: The Negative Binomial Quantile Function (alternative parameterisation) — qneg_binomial_2

what: Zero-inflated Negative-binomial Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_neg_binomial_2_lpmf_stan
title: Zero-inflated Negative-binomial Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_neg_binomial_2_lpmf_stan
text: Stan code zero-inflated negative-binomial log probability mass function.

title: Zero-inflated Negative-binomial Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_neg_binomial_2_lpmf_stan
code: cat(zi_neg_binomial_2_lpmf_stan[["source_code"]]) #> real zi_neg_binomial_2_lpmf(int[] n, vector mu, vector phi, vector pi) { #>  #>   real probability_mass = 0; #>  #>   for (i in 1:size(n)) { #>     if (pi[i] < 0 || pi[i] > 1) { #>       reject("pi should be in [0, 1]; pi=", pi[i]); #>     } #>  #>     // TODO: Would this be more efficient if it used log_sum_exp? #>     probability_mass += log(pi[i] * (n[i] == 0) + (1 - pi[i]) * exp(neg_binomial_2_lpmf(n[i] | mu[i], phi[i]))); #>   } #>  #>   return probability_mass; #> }

what: Zero-inflated Negative-binomial Linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_neg_binomial_linked_2_lpmf_stan
title: Zero-inflated Negative-binomial Linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_neg_binomial_linked_2_lpmf_stan
text: Stan code zero-inflated negative-binomial distribution's log probability mass function, amount zero-inflation function mean.

title: Zero-inflated Negative-binomial Linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_neg_binomial_linked_2_lpmf_stan
code: cat(zi_neg_binomial_linked_2_lpmf_stan[["source_code"]]) #> real zi_neg_binomial_linked_2_lpmf(int[] n, vector mu, vector phi, vector gamma0, vector gamma1) { #>  #>   real probability_mass = 0; #>  #>   for (i in 1:size(n)) { #>     real pi = inv_logit(gamma0[i] + gamma1[i] * mu[i]); #>  #>     // TODO: Would this be more efficient if it used log_sum_exp? #>     probability_mass += log(pi * (n[i] == 0) + (1 - pi) * exp(neg_binomial_2_lpmf(n[i] | mu[i], phi[i]))); #>   } #>  #>   return probability_mass; #> }

what: Zero-inflated Negative-binomial Log-linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_neg_binomial_log_linked_2_lpmf_stan
title: Zero-inflated Negative-binomial Log-linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_neg_binomial_log_linked_2_lpmf_stan
text: Stan code zero-inflated negative-binomial log probability mass function, amount zero-inflation function log(mean).

title: Zero-inflated Negative-binomial Log-linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_neg_binomial_log_linked_2_lpmf_stan
code: cat(zi_neg_binomial_log_linked_2_lpmf_stan[["source_code"]]) #> real zi_neg_binomial_log_linked_2_lpmf(int[] n, vector mu, vector phi, vector gamma0, vector gamma1) { #>  #>   real probability_mass = 0; #>  #>   for (i in 1:size(n)) { #>     real pi = inv_logit(gamma0[i] + gamma1[i] * log(mu[i])); #>  #>     // TODO: Would this be more efficient if it used log_sum_exp? #>     probability_mass += log(pi * (n[i] == 0) + (1 - pi) * exp(neg_binomial_2_lpmf(n[i] | mu[i], phi[i]))); #>   } #>  #>   return probability_mass; #> }

what: Zero-inflated Poisson Linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_poisson_linked_lpmf_stan
title: Zero-inflated Poisson Linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_poisson_linked_lpmf_stan
text: Stan code zero-inflated Poisson distribution's log probability mass function, amount zero-inflation function mean.

title: Zero-inflated Poisson Linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_poisson_linked_lpmf_stan
code: cat(zi_poisson_linked_lpmf_stan[["source_code"]]) #> real zi_poisson_linked_lpmf(int[] n, vector lambda, vector gamma0, vector gamma1) { #>  #>   real probability_mass = 0; #>  #>   for (i in 1:size(n)) { #>     real pi = inv_logit(gamma0[i] + gamma1[i] * lambda[i]); #>  #>     // TODO: Would this be more efficient if it used log_sum_exp? #>     probability_mass += log(pi * (n[i] == 0) + (1 - pi) * exp(poisson_lpmf(n[i] | lambda[i]))); #>   } #>  #>   return probability_mass; #> }

what: Zero-inflated Poisson Linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_poisson_log_linked_lpmf_stan
title: Zero-inflated Poisson Linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_poisson_log_linked_lpmf_stan
text: Stan code zero-inflated Poisson distribution's log probability mass function, amount zero-inflation function log(mean).

title: Zero-inflated Poisson Linked Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_poisson_log_linked_lpmf_stan
code: cat(zi_poisson_log_linked_lpmf_stan[["source_code"]]) #> real zi_poisson_log_linked_lpmf(int[] n, vector lambda, vector gamma0, vector gamma1) { #>  #>   real probability_mass = 0; #>  #>   for (i in 1:size(n)) { #>     real pi = inv_logit(gamma0[i] + gamma1[i] * log(lambda[i])); #>  #>     // TODO: Would this be more efficient if it used log_sum_exp? #>     probability_mass += log(pi * (n[i] == 0) + (1 - pi) * exp(poisson_lpmf(n[i] | lambda[i]))); #>   } #>  #>   return probability_mass; #> }

what: Zero-inflated Poisson Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_poisson_lpmf_stan
title: Zero-inflated Poisson Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_poisson_lpmf_stan
text: Stan code zero-inflated Poisson distribution's probability mass function.

title: Zero-inflated Poisson Log Probability Mass Function Stan Code — zi_poisson_lpmf_stan
code: cat(zi_poisson_lpmf_stan[["source_code"]]) #> // The log probability mass at x, given lambda and pi. #> // lambda is the (non-negative) mean of the poisson distribution. #> // pi is the amount of zero-inflation, which should lie within the range [0, 1]. #> real zi_poisson_lpmf(int[] n, vector lambda, vector pi) { #>  #>   real probability_mass = 0; #>  #>   for (i in 1:size(n)) { #>     if (pi[i] < 0 || pi[i] > 1) { #>       reject("pi should be in [0, 1]; pi=", pi[i]); #>     } #>  #>     // TODO: Would this be more efficient if it used log_sum_exp? #>     probability_mass += log(pi[i] * (n[i] == 0) + (1 - pi[i]) * exp(poisson_lpmf(n[i] | lambda[i]))); #>   } #>  #>   return probability_mass; #> }
